newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil high court rejects challenge to CVRD sale.
newsitem.headline: Brazil high court rejects challenge to CVRD sale.

text.p: Brazil's highest court, the Supreme Federal Tribunal (STF), threw out a constitutional challenge to the upcoming privatization of state mining company CVRD, a court official said on Wednesday.
In a preliminary decision before ruling on the merits of the case itself, the court decided there were no grounds for the challenge brought by a private lawyers group.

The court is also expected to rule on an appeal by the government against an injunction issued Tuesday by a Supreme Federal Tribunal justice. The injunction suspends the federal land transfer to CVRD of 411,000 hectares of land in the Carajas mining region in the northern state of Para.

Another constitutional challenge to the privatization of CVRD, or Companhia Vale do Rio Doce SA, is due to be studied by the high court at a later date. That challenge was also lodged by the lawyers group, the Order of Brazilian Lawyers.
